Documentation

What is samples-framework? ¶

Samples-framework is a set of CSS classes and Less mixins (components) dedicated for CKSource documentation projects and samples. A modular structure of the framework is designed to make any integration fast and DRY.

Installation ¶

Samples-framework mostly depends on Less, Grunt and LESSHat. Use npm to resolve dependencies:

han@falcon ~> npm install

See the example to know more.

Example ¶

  1. Create sample.less file that will compile to sample.css: 
    // Path to samples-framework components.
@components-dir: "samples-framework/components";

// Good 'ol Lesshat.
@import "../../../node_modules/lesshat/build/lesshat";

// Generic components of the page.
@import "@{components-dir}/global/global";
@import "@{components-dir}/core/core";
@import "@{components-dir}/grid/grid";
@import "@{components-dir}/navigation-a/navigation-a";

// Some shared application-specific components and extensions.
@import "@{components-dir}/sdk/core";

// Custom components that do not belong to samples-framework.
@import "components/custom";

// Override some variables in the framework.
// See: http://lesscss.org/features/#variables-feature-default-variables
@global-link-font-color: #FFD8F0;
  2. Compile sample.less. Use grunt-contrib-less and grunt-contrib-watch as a development environment. See the gruntfile.js.
  3. Include sample.css in HTML markup of the project: 
    <link href="css/sample.css" rel="stylesheet">
  4. Use any of component classes imported in sample.less to build the page.
  5. Ship sample.css as a static part of the final package of the project.

Components ¶

Bootstrap

global ¶

Defines global variables and mixins shared between other components.

  • Variables:

    • @global-font-size Default font size used for html/body.

      See: core.

    • @global-font-stack Default font-face stack used for html/body.

      See: core.

    • @global-font-stack-serif Default serif font-face stack.

      See: core.

    • @global-font-stack-monospace Default monospace font-face stack.

      See: core.

    • @global-font-color Default font color.

      See: core.

    • @global-line-height Default line height for html/body.

      See: core.

    • @global-link-font-color Default font color for anchors.

    • @global-link-font-color-hover Default font color for hovered anchors.

    • @global-box-background-color Default background color for boxes.

    • @global-box-border-color Default border color for boxes.

    • @global-flow-vgap Default vertical gap for content flows.

    • @global-border-radius Default border-radius to used for rounded elements.

    • @global-is-mobile-threshold Default threshold between mobile and desktop layout.

      See: global/.global-is-mobile.

  • Mixins:

    • .global-font-size( @font-size-rem, @line-height-ratio: 1 )

      Default font size mixin. It computes line-height considering global@global-line-height and font-size using global@global-font-size The output contains fallback values in "px" for font-size and line-height.

      • Example: Less: 

        .foo {
	.global-font-size( 0.875 );
}

        CSS (note that 14/16 = 0.875):

        .foo {
	font-size: 14px;
	font-size: 0.875rem;
	line-height: 30.24px;
	line-height: 1.89rem;
}

    • .global-font-face( @font-name, @font-path, @font-file, @font-weight: normal, @font-style: normal )

      Generates @font-face block for given webfont.

      • Example:

        Less:

        @font-face {
	.global-font-face( "Roboto", url( "fonts/%s" ), "Roboto-Thin-webfont", 100 );
}

        CSS:

        @font-face {
	font-family: "Roboto";
	src: url("../../../components/font-roboto/fonts/Roboto-Thin-webfont.eot");
	src: url("../../../components/font-roboto/fonts/Roboto-Thin-webfont.eot?#iefix") format("embedded-opentype"), url("../../../components/font-roboto/fonts/Roboto-Thin-webfont.woff") format("woff"), url("../../../components/font-roboto/fonts/Roboto-Thin-webfont.ttf") format("truetype"), url("../../../components/font-roboto/fonts/Roboto-Thin-webfont.svg#Roboto") format("svg");
	font-weight: 100;
	font-style: normal;
}

      Note: Lesshat's .font-face mixin produces paths relative to Lesshat in node_modules. This mixin bypasses that problem.

    • .global-is-min-width( @minWidth, @block )

      Wraps given block with min-width @media query.

    • .global-is-max-width( @maxWidth, @block )

      Wraps given block with max-width @media query.

    • .global-is-mobile( @block )

      Wraps given block with rules specific for mobile view.

      • Example:

        Less:

        .global-is-mobile( {
	.foo {
		color: red;
	}
} );

        CSS:

        @media ( max-width: @global-is-mobile-threshold ) {
	.foo {
		color: red;
	}
}

      See: global@global-is-mobile-threshold.

    • .global-is-desktop( @block )

      Wraps given block with rules specific for desktop view.

      Note: This mixin should not be used to specify default rules because IE8 does not support @media queries.

    • .global-box-border-gradient( @direction: to right )

      Generates standard border gradient with given direction.

      Note: Lesshat's .border-image() mixin does not support linear-gradient correctly.

  • Classes:

    • .global-is-mobile-hidden

      If applied to an element makes it hidden in mobile view. See: global/.global-is-mobile.

      • Example:

        <div class="global-is-mobile-hidden">Visible on desktop and hidden on mobile</div>

    • .global-styled-links

      Enables global colorful styles of <a> within a class which inherits from it.

      • Example:

        // All <a> in .foo will match global link styles.
.foo:extend( .global-styled-links all ) { ... }

        See global@global-link-font-color.

core ¶

A very low level CSS to display the page correctly, including HTML5 block tags for legacy browsers, body and html setup.

Standard

balloon-a ¶

Balloon with an arrow.

  • Classes:

    • .balloon-a
    • .balloon-a-[nw, ne, sw, se] Specifies the alignment of an arrow.

  • Variables:

    • @balloon-a-background-color

  • Example:

    <span class="balloon-a balloon-a-nw">I'm a balloon (arrow NW)</span>
<span class="balloon-a balloon-a-ne">I'm a balloon (arrow NE)</span>

    I'm a balloon (arrow NW) I'm a balloon (arrow NE) I'm a balloon (arrow SW) I'm a balloon (arrow SE)

button-a ¶

A styled button.

  • Classes:

    • .button-a

      A generic button, no background color.

    • .button-a-background

      A generic button with a background. Useful for hover/active button states.

      See: global@global-link-font-color.

    • .button-a-soft

      A generic button with a soft background.

    • .button-a-no-text

      A generic button with nothing but an icon.

      See: icon.

  • Example:

    Anchor element:

    <a href="#" class="button-a button-a-background">With background</a>,
<a href="#" class="button-a button-a-soft">Soft background</a>,
<a href="#" class="button-a">Without background</a>
<a href="#" class="button-a button-a-background button-a-no-text icon-pos-left icon-question-mark">No text</a>

    With background, Soft background, Without background No text

    Button element:

    <button class="button-a button-a-background">With background</button>,
<button class="button-a button-a-soft">Soft background</button>,
<button class="button-a">Without background</button>
<button class="button-a button-a-background button-a-no-text icon-pos-left icon-question-mark">No text</button>

    , ,

toggler ¶

Box visibility toggler.

Please note: You should include javascript file to make this component works. Script should be embedded right before the closing body tag.

	...
	<script src="/components/toggler/js/toggler.js"></script>
</body>
  • Classes:

    • toggler Main class which define toggler.

    • expanded This class is toggled by script when user clicks.

  • Optional classes:

    You can define a default icon for toggler. For more information see icon. Classes listed below will be toggled by script when user clicks.

    • icon-toggler-expanded Define expanded icon.

    • icon-toggler-collapsed Define collapsed icon.

    • icon-light Made icon white.

  • Attributes:

    • data-for Reference to toggled element by it's id. This attribute is obligatory.

  • Example: 
    <div class="grid-container">
	<div data-for="collapseexample" class="toggler expanded icon-pos-right icon-toggler-expanded button-a">
		<label data-collapse>Collapse this box</label>
		<label data-expand>Expand this box</label>
	</div>
	<div id="collapseexample" class="toggler-container grid-width-100">
		<p>Some content.</p>
	</div>
</div>

    Some content.

content ¶

A default styleset for content blocks including paragraphs, lists, blockquotes, headers, pre-formatted, code, kbd, etc.

  • Classes:
    • .content-heading-anchor A class for heading anchor.
  • Example #1: 
    <div class="content">
	<h1 id="first-header">This is a first-level header <a href="#first-header" class="content-heading-anchor" title="Permalink to this headline">&para;</a></h1>
	<p>I'm styled with default styleset.</p>

	<h2 id="another-header">This is another header <a href="#another-header" class="content-heading-anchor" title="Permalink to this headline">&para;</a></h2>
	<p>I'm also styled with default styleset.</p>
</div>
  • Example #2:

footer-a ¶

A default styleset for content blocks including paragraphs, lists, blockquotes, headers, pre-formatted, code, textarea etc.

  • Example: 
    <footer class="footer-a">
	I'm a footer!
</footer>

grid ¶

A grid system for the framework.

  • Classes:

    • .grid-container
    • .grid-container-nested For use inside .grid-width-*, discards left/right padding of first/last column.
    • .grid-width-[10,20,30,...,100]

  • Variables:

    • @grid-gutter-width Gap between the columns.
    • @grid-width-step

  • Example:

    <div class="grid-container">
	<div class="grid-width-50">
		Column 1
	</div>
	<div class="grid-width-50">
		Column 2
		<div class="grid-container [grid-container-nested]">
			<div class="grid-width-30">
				Column 2-1
			</div>
			<div class="grid-width-70">
				Column 2-2
			</div>
		</div>
	</div>
</div>

Note: In mobile view, all columns are stacked vertically. See: global/.global-is-mobile.

header-a ¶

Generic header of the website.

  • Classes:

    • .header-a
    • .header-a-logo A class for the logo of the page, i.e. project logo. By default logo is 65px height.

  • Variables:

    • @header-a-height

  • Example:

    <header class="header-a">
	<div class="grid-container">
		<h1 class="header-a-logo grid-width-30">
			<a href="#"><img src="logo.png" alt="Logo"></a>
		</h1>
		<nav class="...">
			...
		</nav>
	</div>
</header>

icon ¶

Generic icons framework. Icons may be used along with button-a or standalone.

  • Classes:

    • .icon-pos-left
    • .icon-pos-right

  • Variables:

    • @icon-size
    • @icon-margin

  • Example:

    // Button
<a href="#" class="button-a button-a-background icon-pos-left icon-navigation-a-github">icon-pos-left</a>,

// Standalone
<span class="icon-pos-right icon-tree-a-collapsed">icon-pos-right</span>

    icon-pos-left, icon-pos-right

  • Icons:

modal ¶

A JavaScript modal component, wrapper for PicoModal.

Note: PicoModal does not work on IE8.

  • Classes:

    • .modal
    • .modal-close

  • Variables:

    • @modal-close-size

  • Example:

    new SF.modal( {
	content: 'Hello world!'
} ).show();

navigation-a ¶

Absolutely positioned horizontal bar, usually with useful links to project-related resources i.e. GitHub, bug tracker, blog, etc.

  • Classes:

    • .navigation-a
    • .navigation-a-[left,right] Left and right-aligned blocks of links.

  • Variables:

    • @navigation-a-background-color
    • @navigation-a-font-color
    • @navigation-a-font-color-hover
    • @navigation-a-default-height
    • @navigation-a-item-gap

  • Example:

    <nav class="navigation-a">
	<div class="grid-container">
		<ul class="navigation-a-left grid-width-70">
			<li><a href="#">Project Homepage</a></li>
			<li class="global-is-mobile-hidden">...</li>
			...
		</ul>
		<ul class="navigation-a-right grid-width-30">
			<li><a href="#">Blog</a></li>
		</ul>
	</div>
</nav>

Note: Use global/global-is-mobile-hidden class to hide some items for best mobile performance.

navigation-b ¶

Horizontal navigation between essential sub-pages of the project. Placed in header-a in consists of components-button-a elements.

  • Classes:

    • .navigation-b

  • Example:

    <nav class="navigation-b">
	<ul>
		<li><a href="#" class="button-a button-a-background">Foo</a></li>
		<li><a href="#" class="button-a">Bar</a></li>
		<li><a href="#" class="button-a">Bam</a></li>
	</ul>
</nav>

switcher ¶

Switch which behave like two elements radio form input.

  • Variables:

    • @switch-vpadding
    • @switch-hspacing
    • @switch-text-padding
    • @switch-handler-side

  • Example:

    <div class="switch">
	<input type="radio" name="radio" data-num="1" id="radio-1" checked />
	<input type="radio" name="radio" data-num="2" id="radio-2" />
	<label data-for="1" for="radio-1">Advanced</label>
	<span class="switch-inner">
		<span class="handler"></span>
	</span>
	<label data-for="2" for="radio-2">Basic</label>
</div>

Note: To make switcher work on IE8, you have add class "ie8" to <html> element on related browser. You can use conditional classes to achieve this.

tree-a ¶

A vertical two-level collapsible menu. Best for long navigation lists of multiple levels.

  • Classes:

    • .tree-a
    • .tree-a-layout A tree that is used to create a layout.
    • .tree-a-standalone A tree that can be used within content.
    • .tree-a-active
    • .tree-a-no-sub

  • Variables:

    • @tree-a-link-font-color
    • @tree-a-active-group-color-a
    • @tree-a-active-group-color-b
    • @tree-a-active-group-background
    • @tree-a-item-v-gap

  • Example:

    Sample tree

    Item #1 - active

    Item #2

    Item #3

    • Sub-item #1
    • Sub-item #2
    • Sub-item #3
    <nav class="tree-a tree-a-standalone">
	<h1>Sample tree</h1>

	<h2 class="tree-a-no-sub tree-a-active"><a href="#">Item #1 - active</a></h2>
	<h2 class="tree-a-no-sub"><a href="#">Item #2</a></h2>

	<h2 class="tree-a-active">Item #3</h2>
	<ul>
		<li><a href="#">Sub-item #1</a></li>
		<li class="tree-a-active"><a href="#">Sub-item #2</a></li>
		<li><a href="#">Sub-item #3</a></li>
	</ul>
</nav>

tip-a ¶

An informational box.

  • Classes:

    • .tip-a
    • .tip-a-alert

  • Variables:

    • @tip-a-alert-background-color

  • Example:

    <div class="tip-a">
	This is some important information.
</div>

<div class="tip-a tip-a-alert">
	This is some critical information.
</div>
    This is some important information.
    This is some critical information.

Application-specific

sdk ¶

A default look and layout of SDK. It includes:

  • Wide, spacious horizontally centered layout.
  • <h1> header with .documentation button.
  • Fancy links with tiny icons indicating whether it is a sample, guide or API link.
  • Integration with tree-a.

See SDK sample.

  • Classes:

    • .sdk-documentation An inline button-link inside a top-level header.

      • Example: 
        <h1>A header
	<span class="sdk-documentation">
		<a href="#" class="button-a button-a-background button-a-icon-left icon-docs-a">Documentation</a>
	</span>
</h1>

  • Variables:

    • @sdk-link-api-selector Element selector for API link.
    • @sdk-link-guide-selector Element selector for guide link.
    • @sdk-link-sample-selector Element selector for sample link.

basicsample ¶

A default look of a basic sample. A centered slightly narrower layout than components-sdk.

See Basicsample, basicsample/adjoined.

  • Subcomponents:

    • basicsample/adjoined ¶

      An extension of basicsample. Designed to present an instance of editor with a fancy header and short description.

      • Classes:

        • .adjoined-top A class of a container with a header and description.
        • .adjoined-bottom A class of a container with instance of the editor.

      • Example:

        <header class="header-a">
	<div class="grid-container">
		...
	</div>
	<div class="adjoined-top">
		<div class="grid-container">
			<div class="content grid-width-100">
				(description part)
			</div>
		</div>
	</div>
	<div class="adjoined-bottom">
		<div class="grid-container">
			<div class="grid-width-100">
				(editor part)
			</div>
		</div>
	</div>
</header>
